refnamediv.refpurpose: text buffers which grow automatically as text is added

refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: A GString is similar to a standard C string, except that it grows automatically as text is appended or inserted. Also, it stores the length of the string, so can be used for binary data with embedded nul bytes.

refsect2.title: GString
refsect2.para: The GString struct contains the public fields of a GString.

listitem.simpara: points to the character data. It may move as text is added. The str field is nul-terminated and so can be used as an ordinary C string.
contains the length of the string, not including the terminating nul byte.
the number of bytes that can be stored in the string before it needs to be reallocated. May be larger than len.

refsect2.title: g_string_new ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new GString, initialized with the given string.

listitem.simpara: the initial text to copy into the string

refsect2.title: g_string_new_len ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new GString with len bytes of the init buffer. Because a length is provided, init need not be nul-terminated, and can contain embedded nul bytes.
Since this function does not stop at nul bytes, it is the caller's responsibility to ensure that init has at least len addressable bytes.

refsect2.title: g_string_sized_new ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new GString, with enough space for dfl_size bytes. This is useful if you are going to add a lot of text to the string and don't want it to be reallocated too often.

listitem.simpara: the default size of the space allocated to hold the string

refsect2.title: g_string_assign ()
refsect2.para: Copies the bytes from a string into a GString, destroying any previous contents. It is rather like the standard strcpy() function, except that you do not have to worry about having enough space to copy the string.

listitem.simpara: the destination GString. Its current contents are destroyed.
the string to copy into string

refsect2.title: g_string_sprintf

warning.para: g_string_sprintf is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code. This function has been renamed to g_string_printf().

refsect2.para: Writes a formatted string into a GString. This is similar to the standard sprintf() function, except that the GString buffer automatically expands to contain the results. The previous contents of the GString are destroyed.

listitem.simpara: the string format. See the sprintf() documentation
the parameters to insert into the format string

refsect2.title: g_string_sprintfa

warning.para: g_string_sprintfa is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code. This function has been renamed to g_string_append_printf()

refsect2.para: Appends a formatted string onto the end of a GString. This function is similar to g_string_sprintf() except that the text is appended to the GString.

listitem.simpara: the string format. See the sprintf() documentation
the parameters to insert into the format string

refsect2.title: g_string_vprintf ()
refsect2.para: Writes a formatted string into a GString. This function is similar to g_string_printf() except that the arguments to the format string are passed as a va_list.

listitem.simpara: the string format. See the printf() documentation
the parameters to insert into the format string

refsect2.para: Since 2.14

refsect2.title: g_string_append_vprintf ()
refsect2.para: Appends a formatted string onto the end of a GString. This function is similar to g_string_append_printf() except that the arguments to the format string are passed as a va_list.

listitem.simpara: the string format. See the printf() documentation
the list of arguments to insert in the output

refsect2.para: Since 2.14

refsect2.title: g_string_printf ()
refsect2.para: Writes a formatted string into a GString. This is similar to the standard sprintf() function, except that the GString buffer automatically expands to contain the results. The previous contents of the GString are destroyed.

listitem.simpara: the string format. See the printf() documentation
the parameters to insert into the format string

refsect2.title: g_string_append_printf ()
refsect2.para: Appends a formatted string onto the end of a GString. This function is similar to g_string_printf() except that the text is appended to the GString.

listitem.simpara: the string format. See the printf() documentation
the parameters to insert into the format string

refsect2.title: g_string_append ()
refsect2.para: Adds a string onto the end of a GString, expanding it if necessary.

listitem.simpara: the string to append onto the end of string

refsect2.title: g_string_append_c ()
refsect2.para: Adds a byte onto the end of a GString, expanding it if necessary.

listitem.simpara: the byte to append onto the end of string

refsect2.title: g_string_append_unichar ()
refsect2.para: Converts a Unicode character into UTF-8, and appends it to the string.

refsect2.title: g_string_append_len ()
refsect2.para: Appends len bytes of val to string. Because len is provided, val may contain embedded nuls and need not be nul-terminated.
Since this function does not stop at nul bytes, it is the caller's responsibility to ensure that val has at least len addressable bytes.

listitem.simpara: number of bytes of val to use

refsect2.title: g_string_append_uri_escaped ()
refsect2.programlisting: GString* g_string_append_uri_escaped (GString *string, const char *unescaped, const char *reserved_chars_allowed, gboolean allow_utf8);
refsect2.para: Appends unescaped to string, escaped any characters that are reserved in URIs using URI-style escape sequences.

listitem.simpara: a string of reserved characters allowed to be used
set TRUE if the escaped string may include UTF8 characters

refsect2.para: Since 2.16

refsect2.title: g_string_prepend ()
refsect2.para: Adds a string on to the start of a GString, expanding it if necessary.

listitem.simpara: the string to prepend on the start of string

refsect2.title: g_string_prepend_c ()
refsect2.para: Adds a byte onto the start of a GString, expanding it if necessary.

listitem.simpara: the byte to prepend on the start of the GString

refsect2.title: g_string_prepend_unichar ()
refsect2.para: Converts a Unicode character into UTF-8, and prepends it to the string.

refsect2.title: g_string_prepend_len ()
refsect2.para: Prepends len bytes of val to string. Because len is provided, val may contain embedded nuls and need not be nul-terminated.
Since this function does not stop at nul bytes, it is the caller's responsibility to ensure that val has at least len addressable bytes.

listitem.simpara: number of bytes in val to prepend

refsect2.title: g_string_insert ()
refsect2.para: Inserts a copy of a string into a GString, expanding it if necessary.

listitem.simpara: the position to insert the copy of the string

refsect2.title: g_string_insert_c ()
refsect2.para: Inserts a byte into a GString, expanding it if necessary.

listitem.simpara: the position to insert the byte

refsect2.title: g_string_insert_unichar ()
refsect2.para: Converts a Unicode character into UTF-8, and insert it into the string at the given position.

listitem.simpara: the position at which to insert character, or -1 to append at the end of the string

refsect2.title: g_string_insert_len ()
refsect2.programlisting: GString* g_string_insert_len (GString *string, gssize pos, const gchar *val, gssize len);
refsect2.para: Inserts len bytes of val into string at pos. Because len is provided, val may contain embedded nuls and need not be nul-terminated. If pos is -1, bytes are inserted at the end of the string.
Since this function does not stop at nul bytes, it is the caller's responsibility to ensure that val has at least len addressable bytes.

listitem.simpara: position in string where insertion should happen, or -1 for at the end
number of bytes of val to insert

refsect2.title: g_string_overwrite ()
refsect2.para: Overwrites part of a string, lengthening it if necessary.

listitem.simpara: the position at which to start overwriting
the string that will overwrite the string starting at pos

refsect2.para: Since 2.14

refsect2.title: g_string_overwrite_len ()
refsect2.programlisting: GString* g_string_overwrite_len (GString *string, gsize pos, const gchar *val, gssize len);
refsect2.para: Overwrites part of a string, lengthening it if necessary. This function will work with embedded nuls.

listitem.simpara: the position at which to start overwriting
the string that will overwrite the string starting at pos
the number of bytes to write from val

refsect2.para: Since 2.14

refsect2.title: g_string_erase ()
refsect2.para: Removes len bytes from a GString, starting at position pos. The rest of the GString is shifted down to fill the gap.

listitem.simpara: the position of the content to remove
the number of bytes to remove, or -1 to remove all following bytes

refsect2.title: g_string_truncate ()
refsect2.para: Cuts off the end of the GString, leaving the first len bytes.

refsect2.title: g_string_set_size ()
refsect2.para: Sets the length of a GString. If the length is less than the current length, the string will be truncated. If the length is greater than the current length, the contents of the newly added area are undefined. (However, as always, string->str[string->len] will be a nul byte.)

refsect2.title: g_string_free ()
refsect2.para: Frees the memory allocated for the GString. If free_segment is TRUE it also frees the character data.

listitem.simpara: if TRUE the actual character data is freed as well
the character data of string (i.e. NULL if free_segment is TRUE)

refsect2.title: g_string_up ()

warning.para: g_string_up has been deprecated since version 2.2 and should not be used in newly-written code. This function uses the locale-specific toupper() function, which is almost never the right thing. Use g_string_ascii_up() or g_utf8_strup() instead.

refsect2.para: Converts a GString to uppercase.

refsect2.title: g_string_down ()

warning.para: g_string_down has been deprecated since version 2.2 and should not be used in newly-written code. This function uses the locale-specific tolower() function, which is almost never the right thing. Use g_string_ascii_down() or g_utf8_strdown() instead.

refsect2.para: Converts a GString to lowercase.

refsect2.title: g_string_hash ()
refsect2.para: Creates a hash code for str; for use with GHashTable.

refsect2.title: g_string_equal ()
refsect2.para: Compares two strings for equality, returning TRUE if they are equal. For use with GHashTable.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if they strings are the same length and contain the same bytes
